answers.answer: Hi,The presence of Non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma in the past shouldn’t disqualify one from the heart transplant and thus one can go ahead with the same. The presence of other ailments like diabetes or kidney disease can affect the transplanted heart. However, please do consult a cardiologist & an oncologist for the same. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care.

question: I was recently diagnosed with Congestive Heart Failure.  I was advised I would eventually need a heart transplant.I was treated for Non-Hodgkins Lymphoma 6 years ago, would this disqualify me for transplant ?
title: Viable candidate
